problem_text: In \odot X, WS, VR, and QT are diameters, m \angle WXV = 25 and m \angle VXU = 45. Find the measure of \widehat WRV.
proof:
Step 1:
Theorem: Known facts
Premises : start
Conclusions: X on RV, TX ⊥ VX, pi * (25 / 180) = ∠WXV, ∠RXT, ∠WXU, ∠VXT, ∠TXS, X on SW, ∠TXV, ∠TXW, ∠UXT, pi * (45 / 180) = ∠VXU, ∠SXV, ∠UXS, ∠RXU, ∠VXU, ∠SXR, ∠TXR, Arc(VXW), 3.14 = pi, RX ⊥ TX, ∠WXV

Step 2:
Theorem: Perpendicular to Right Angle
Premises : TX ⊥ VX
Conclusions: (3 * pi) / 2 = ∠TXV, pi / 2 = ∠VXT

Step 3:
Theorem: Vertical Angle Theorem
Premises : X on SW, X on RV
Conclusions: ∠SXV = ∠WXR, ∠SXR = ∠WXV

Step 4:
Theorem: Circumference splited
Premises : ∠WXU, ∠UXT, ∠TXW
Conclusions: 2 * pi = ∠TXW + ∠UXT + ∠WXU

Step 5:
Theorem: Circumference splited
Premises : ∠TXS, ∠VXT, ∠SXV
Conclusions: 2 * pi = ∠SXV + ∠TXS + ∠VXT

Step 6:
Theorem: Circumference splited
Premises : ∠TXV, ∠VXU, ∠UXT
Conclusions: 2 * pi = ∠TXV + ∠UXT + ∠VXU

Step 7:
Theorem: Circumference splited
Premises : ∠VXU, ∠UXS, ∠SXV
Conclusions: 2 * pi = ∠SXV + ∠UXS + ∠VXU

Step 8:
Theorem: Circumference splited
Premises : ∠SXR, ∠UXS, ∠RXU
Conclusions: 2 * pi = ∠RXU + ∠SXR + ∠UXS

Step 9:
Theorem: Circumference splited
Premises : ∠TXS, ∠RXT, ∠SXR
Conclusions: 2 * pi = ∠RXT + ∠SXR + ∠TXS

Step 10:
Theorem: Circumference splited
Premises : ∠TXR, ∠UXT, ∠RXU
Conclusions: 2 * pi = ∠RXU + ∠TXR + ∠UXT

Step 11:
Theorem: Arc Measure equals Angle Measure
Premises : Arc(VXW)
Conclusions: ∠VXW = Arc(VXW)

Step 12:
Theorem: Perpendicular to Right Angle
Premises : RX ⊥ TX
Conclusions: pi / 2 = ∠TXR, (3 * pi) / 2 = ∠RXT

Step 13:
Theorem: Reverse Angle Definition
Premises : ∠WXV
Conclusions: ∠WXV = 2 * pi - ∠VXW

Step 14:
Theorem: Transtivity of Equivalence
Premises : pi * (25 / 180) = ∠WXV, ∠SXR = ∠WXV
Conclusions: pi * (25 / 180) = ∠SXR

Step 15:
Theorem: Substitution
Premises : 3.14 = pi, 2 * pi = ∠TXW + ∠UXT + ∠WXU
Conclusions: 2 * 3.14 = ∠TXW + ∠UXT + ∠WXU

Step 16:
Theorem: Substitution
Premises : 3.14 = pi, 2 * pi = ∠SXV + ∠TXS + ∠VXT, pi / 2 = ∠VXT, ∠SXV = ∠WXR
Conclusions: 2 * 3.14 = pi / 2 + ∠TXS + ∠WXR

Step 17:
Theorem: Substitution
Premises : (3 * pi) / 2 = ∠TXV, 2 * pi = ∠TXV + ∠UXT + ∠VXU, 3.14 = pi, pi * (45 / 180) = ∠VXU
Conclusions: 2 * 3.14 = (3 * 3.14) / 2 + 3.14 * (45 / 180) + ∠UXT

Step 18:
Theorem: Substitution
Premises : 3.14 = pi, 2 * pi = ∠SXV + ∠UXS + ∠VXU, ∠SXV = ∠WXR, pi * (45 / 180) = ∠VXU
Conclusions: 2 * 3.14 = pi * (45 / 180) + ∠UXS + ∠WXR

Step 19:
Theorem: Substitution
Premises : 3.14 = pi, 2 * pi = ∠RXU + ∠TXR + ∠UXT, pi / 2 = ∠TXR
Conclusions: 2 * 3.14 = 3.14 / 2 + ∠RXU + ∠UXT

Step 20:
Theorem: Transtivity of Equivalence
Premises : pi * (25 / 180) = ∠WXV, ∠WXV = 2 * pi - ∠VXW
Conclusions: pi * (25 / 180) = 2 * pi - ∠VXW

Step 21:
Theorem: Substitution
Premises : 3.14 = pi, (3 * pi) / 2 = ∠RXT, pi * (25 / 180) = ∠SXR, 2 * pi = ∠RXT + ∠SXR + ∠TXS
Conclusions: 2 * 3.14 = (3 * pi) / 2 + 3.14 * (25 / 180) + ∠TXS

Step 22:
Theorem: Substitution
Premises : 3.14 = pi, 2 * pi = ∠RXU + ∠SXR + ∠UXS, pi * (25 / 180) = ∠SXR
Conclusions: 2 * 3.14 = 3.14 * (25 / 180) + ∠RXU + ∠UXS

Step 23:
Theorem: Transtivity of Equivalence
Premises : 2 * 3.14 = ∠TXW + ∠UXT + ∠WXU, 2 * pi = ∠TXW + ∠UXT + ∠WXU
Conclusions: 2 * 3.14 = 2 * pi

Step 24:
Theorem: Transtivity of Equivalence
Premises : 2 * 3.14 = 2 * pi, 2 * 3.14 = 3.14 * (25 / 180) + ∠RXU + ∠UXS
Conclusions: 2 * pi = 3.14 * (25 / 180) + ∠RXU + ∠UXS

Step 25:
Theorem: Transtivity of Equivalence
Premises : 2 * 3.14 = 2 * pi, 2 * 3.14 = (3 * 3.14) / 2 + 3.14 * (45 / 180) + ∠UXT
Conclusions: 2 * pi = (3 * 3.14) / 2 + 3.14 * (45 / 180) + ∠UXT

Step 26:
Theorem: Transtivity of Equivalence
Premises : 2 * 3.14 = 2 * pi, 2 * 3.14 = pi / 2 + ∠TXS + ∠WXR
Conclusions: 2 * pi = pi / 2 + ∠TXS + ∠WXR

Step 27:
Theorem: Solve Linear Equation System
Premises : 2 * pi = 3.14 * (25 / 180) + ∠RXU + ∠UXS, 2 * pi = (3 * 3.14) / 2 + 3.14 * (45 / 180) + ∠UXT, 2 * 3.14 = pi * (45 / 180) + ∠UXS + ∠WXR, 2 * 3.14 = (3 * pi) / 2 + 3.14 * (25 / 180) + ∠TXS, pi * (25 / 180) = 2 * pi - ∠VXW, 2 * pi = pi / 2 + ∠TXS + ∠WXR, 2 * 3.14 = 3.14 / 2 + ∠RXU + ∠UXT
Conclusions: 5.85 = ∠VXW

Step 28:
Theorem: Transtivity of Equivalence
Premises : ∠VXW = Arc(VXW), 5.85 = ∠VXW
Conclusions: 5.85 = Arc(VXW)
